units.title: Transfer tissue to Falcon tube
units.text: 1 Transfer each tissue sample (<3–4 cm3) into a separate 50-ml Falcon tube ﬁlled with D-BSA. Keep tissues on ice until starting the isolation.
units.rationale: Moves the sample into a transport container while keeping it cold for preservation.

units.title: Cut tissue into small pieces
units.text: 6 Aspirate the excess D-BSA and cut the tissue into small pieces (2–4 mm3) using two scalpels by holding one scalpel in each hand and slicing the tissue while pressing the blades of both scalpels against each other.
units.rationale: Creates uniformly sized fragments to improve enzymatic digestion.

units.title: Add collagenase and ROCK inhibitor
units.text: 17 Add 500 µl of collagenase (20 mg/ml stock, ﬁnal concentration 1 mg/ml) and 10 µl of ROCK inhibitor (10 mM stock, ﬁnal concentration 10 µM) to the 50-ml Falcon tube containing the minced tissue.
units.rationale: Introduces enzymes that digest extracellular matrix and a ROCK inhibitor to enhance cell survival.

units.title: Incubate on orbital shaker
units.text: 18 Wrap the 50-ml Falcon tube with Paraﬁlm and place the tube at a slight angle (~15°) on top of an orbital shaker located inside a heated incubator oven at 37 °C. Set the orbital shaker at 140 r.p.m. and digest the tissue for 1–2 h. At this moment, the processing of the next tissue can be initiated.
units.rationale: Provides controlled digestion conditions while allowing parallel processing of other samples.

units.title: Monitor digestion progress
units.text: 19 Pipette up and down 5–10 times every 30 min using a 5-ml sterile serological pipette pre‑wetted with D‑BSA medium to aid digestion. Monitor the digestion of the tissue at least every 30 min, using an inverted bright‑field microscope (×5, ×10 or ×20 objective). When clusters of 5–10 cells are observed (Fig. 2g), digestion is complete.
units.rationale: Ensures optimal digestion time by visual inspection of cell clusters.

units.title: Stop collagenase activity
units.text: 20 After incubation, take the tube from the heated incubator oven and clean with 70% EtOH. Add 1 ml of FBS directly to the 50-ml Falcon tube to stop the collagenase digestion.
units.rationale: Neutralizes the enzyme to prevent over‑digestion and protects cells.

units.title: Centrifuge flow‑through
units.text: 27 Centrifuge the flow‑through from Steps 22–26 at 450g for 5 min at 8 °C.
units.rationale: Pellets cells while removing remaining supernatant and debris.

units.title: Red blood cell lysis (optional)
units.text: 31 (Optional) If the pellet is partially red, add 1–2 ml of red blood cell lysis buffer with a P1000 pipette, resuspend the pellet by pipetting up and down several times and incubate for 2 min at RT before continuing with Step 32.
units.rationale: Removes contaminating red blood cells that could interfere with organoid culture.

units.title: Resuspend pellet in BME
units.text: 34 Resuspend the pellet in an appropriate amount of BME. As a guideline, 200 µl is sufficient for a pellet of ~50 µl. The amount of BME to add scales linearly with the pellet volume.
units.rationale: Provides a supportive extracellular matrix for 3D organoid growth.

units.title: Add expansion medium
units.text: 38 Add 750 µl of pre‑warmed (RT to 37 °C) Type 1 or Type 2 medium to each well and transfer to an incubator at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Supplies nutrients and growth factors necessary for organoid establishment.
